eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons.engines.xmpp

Class XmppMessageEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons.engines.CommunicationEngine
      • eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons.engines.xmpp.XmppMessageEngine

  • public class XmppMessageEngine
extends CommunicationEngine
    This is the reference implementation of XMPP message engine based on Ignite Realtime's SMACK library for OGWAPI. It uses messages to transport data across the XMPP network (as opposed to streams).
    Author:
    sulfo

      • CONFIG_PARAM_XMPPDEBUG

        private static final java.lang.String CONFIG_PARAM_XMPPDEBUG
        Enables debugging of the XMPP communication between the Gateway and the server / other Gateways. Note that this is to be used in conjunction with the SMACK debugger, which is external tool.
        See Also:
        http://download.igniterealtime.org/smack/docs/latest/documentation/debugging.html., Constant Field Values

      • XMPP_RESOURCE

        private static final java.lang.String XMPP_RESOURCE
        This is the resource part of the full JID used in the communication. It is necessary to set it and not leave it to default value, which is auto generated to random string.

    • Constructor Detail

      • XmppMessageEngine

        public XmppMessageEngine(java.lang.String objectId,
                         java.lang.String password,
                         org.apache.commons.configuration2.XMLConfiguration config,
                         java.util.logging.Logger logger,
                         ConnectionDescriptor connectionDescriptor)
        Constructor for the XMPP message engine. It initialises fields and a Timer that periodically in interval that is randomly set, executes the renewPresenceAndRoster method.
        Parameters:
        objectId - String with the object ID that connects via this engine.
        password - Password string for authentication.
        config - Configuration of the OGWAPI.
        logger - Logger of the OGWAPI.
        connectionDescriptor - Connection descriptor that is using this particular instance of engine.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public boolean connect()
        Connects to the XMPP server and logs the user in. It also registers a listener for incoming messages for this connection (see ChatManager). In case of failure it is possible to re-try. It attempts to be optimised in a sense that it does not rebuilds a connection object if it already exists.
        Specified by:
        connect in class CommunicationEngine
        Parameters:
        objectId - ID that serves as XMPP user name.
        password - Password for authentication.
        Returns:
        True on success, false otherwise.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Closes the connection to the XMPP server. The connection can be re-opened.
        Specified by:
        disconnect in class CommunicationEngine

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns true if the connection to the XMPP server is opened.
        Specified by:
        isConnected in class CommunicationEngine
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • getRoster

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getRoster()
        Retrieves a contact list of the current XMPP user.
        Specified by:
        getRoster in class CommunicationEngine
        Returns:
        A set of object IDs from the Roster for this connection. In case of error it just returns empty set (not null).

      • sendMessage

        public boolean sendMessage(java.lang.String destinationObjectID,
                           java.lang.String message)
        Sends a string to the destination XMPP user name.
        Specified by:
        sendMessage in class CommunicationEngine
        Parameters:
        destinationUsername - Destination contact, for which the message is intended.
        message - A string to send.
        Returns:
        True on success, false if the destination object is offline or if error occurred.

      • buildNewConnection

        private org.jivesoftware.smack.AbstractXMPPConnection buildNewConnection(java.lang.String xmppUsername,
                                                                         java.lang.String xmppPassword)
        Builds the connection object based on OGWAPI configuration and the provided credentials.
        Parameters:
        xmppUsername - XMPP user name without the served domain (i.e. just 'user' instead of 'user@xmpp.server').
        xmppPassword - Password of the user.
        Returns:
        The established connection if the attempt was successful, null otherwise.

      • processMessage

        private void processMessage(org.jxmpp.jid.EntityBareJid from,
                            org.jivesoftware.smack.packet.Message xmppMessage,
                            org.jivesoftware.smack.chat2.Chat chat)
        This method gets executed when a new message for this object ID arrives. It then gets forwarded to its ConnectionDescriptor.
        Parameters:
        from - XMPP JID of the originating object (with domain).
        xmppMessage - Received XMPP message.
        chat - A chat in which the messages were exchanged.

      • renewPresenceAndRoster

        private void renewPresenceAndRoster()
        The rosters in SMACK sometimes failed to initialise in the real production environment, especially when OGWAPI is trying to log in many users at once. This method gets triggered by a timer initialised in the constructor and periodically retrieves new version of roster, while also sending a presence stanza to server. This might not be the best approach, but it seems to have solved some issues that users of OGWAPI were experiencing.

      • processRosterEntriesAdded

        private void processRosterEntriesAdded(java.util.Collection<org.jxmpp.jid.Jid> addresses)
        A callback method called when entries are added into the roster. In this implementation it serves nothing, but can be helpful when debugging.
        Parameters:
        addresses - A collection of JID addresses that were added.

      • processRosterEntriesDeleted

        private void processRosterEntriesDeleted(java.util.Collection<org.jxmpp.jid.Jid> addresses)
        A callback method called when entries are deleted from the roster. In this implementation it serves nothing, but can be helpful when debugging.
        Parameters:
        addresses - A collection of JID addresses that were deleted.

      • processRosterEntriesUpdated

        private void processRosterEntriesUpdated(java.util.Collection<org.jxmpp.jid.Jid> addresses)
        A callback method called when entries are updated in the roster. In this implementation it serves nothing, but can be helpful when debugging.
        Parameters:
        addresses - A collection of JID addresses that were updated.

      • processRosterPresenceChanged

        private void processRosterPresenceChanged(org.jivesoftware.smack.packet.Presence presence)
        A callback method called when the presence of the current connection is changed. In this implementation it serves nothing, but can be helpful when debugging.
        Parameters:
        presence - A new presence.
